{{Use Indian English|date=September 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2016}} {{Infobox settlement | name = Anjangaon | native_name = Anjangaon Surji | native_name_lang = | other_name = | nickname = | settlement_type = City | image_skyline = | image_alt = | image_caption = | pushpin_map = India Maharashtra#India | pushpin_label_position = right | pushpin_map_alt = | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Maharashtra, India | coordinates = {{coord|21.16|N|77.31|E|display=inline,title}} | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{flag|India}} | subdivision_type1 = [[States and territories of India|State]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Maharashtra]] | subdivision_type2 = [[List of regions of India|Region]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Vidarbha]] | subdivision_type3 = [[List of districts of India|District]] | subdivision_name3 = [[Amravati district|Amravati]] | established_title = | established_date = 1981 | founder = | named_for = [[Banana]] & [[Betel]] | government_type = Municipal Council | governing_body = Local | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_rank = | area_total_km2 = 3.37 | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = 374 | population_total = 56380 | population_as_of = 2011 | population_rank = | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = Anjangaonkar | population_footnotes = | demographics_type1 = Languages | demographics1_title1 = Official | demographics1_info1 = [[Marathi language|Marathi]] , | timezone1 = [[Indian Standard Time|IST]] | utc_offset1 = +5:30 | postal_code_type = [[Postal Index Number|PIN]] | postal_code = Anjangaon 444 705
Surji 444 728 | area_code_type = Telephone code | area_code = 07224 | registration_plate = MH-27 | website = NA | footnotes = }} '''Anjangaon''' is a city and a [[municipal council]] in [[Amravati district]] in the state of [[Maharashtra]], [[India]]. It is technically made up of two cities, Anjangaon and Surji, on either side of [[Shahanur River]], and is called '''Anjangaon-Surji''' in combination. Anjangaon is located at {{Coord|21.1641|N|77.3159|E|}}.[http://www.fallingrain.com/world/IN/16/Anjangaon.html Falling Rain Genomics, Inc - Anjangaon] It has an average elevation of 374 metres (1227 feet). == History == Anjangaon Surji is an ancient town having religious and historical importance. After the [[Battle of Assaye]] and the [[Adgaon#Battle of Argaon|Battle of Argaum]], the [[Treaty of Surji-Anjangaon]] was signed on 30 December 1803 at Anjangaon between the British and [[Daulat Rao Sindhia]], chief of the Maratha people. In 18th century Vithoji Narayan was awarded the vatandari of Anjangaon. There are records that he was awarded with a title 'Surji'. Anjangaon is mentioned as one of 46 Mahals of Vidarbha in [[Ain-i-Akbari]]. The revenue of Anjangaon as mentioned in Ain-i-Akbari was 32 lakhs. The river [[Shahanur River|Shahanoor]] on the banks of which Anjangaon is located, was historically named as Sharneera (meaning river generated by an arrow ). A popular story exists that during the year of banishment, [[Arjuna]] generated the water stream by hitting the soil by an arrow.[http://www.loksatta.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=129359:2011-01-14-15-08-21&Itemid=1] The Devnath Math in Surji was established in 1754 AD. Saint Ruplal Maharaj established a famous Vitthal Mandir in this town. This is a city of betel leaves. Previously betel leaves were exported from here to Indonesia, Pakistan and Arabian countries. Now this place is known for cultivation of Piper nigrum, a medicinal plant. According to Imperial Gazetteer of India [http://www.ebooksread.com/authors-eng/william-wilson-hunter/the-imperial-gazetteer-of-india-tnu/page-38-the-imperial-gazetteer-of-india-tnu.shtml] (William Wilson Hunter), "in the year 1881, the population of Anjangaon was 9842 consisting of 5060 males and 4782 females. Of the total population, 7714 were returned as Hindus, 1955 Musalmans, 6 Sikhs, and 167 Jains. A mart for cotton cloth, excellent basket-work, and pan grown in the adjacent garden lands. Large weekly market". Anjangaon City got the status of [[Municipal Council]] in 1930. It is the first municipal council established in Amravati district & the second biggest council as well.{{Cite web |url=http://amravati.nic.in/gazetteer/gazetteerb/local_municipalties.html |title=Archived copy |access-date=22 June 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318214659/http://amravati.nic.in/gazetteer/gazetteerb/local_municipalties.html |archive-date=18 March 2012 |url-status=dead }} Anjangaon Surji Tehsil was established in 1981. == Demographics == {{As of|2011}} India [[census]],{{cite web|url=http://www.censusindia.net/results/town.php?stad=A&state5=999|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040616075334/http://www.censusindia.net/results/town.php?stad=A&state5=999|archivedate=16 June 2004|title= Census of India 2001: Data from the 2001 Census, including cities, villages and towns (Provisional)|accessdate=1 November 2008|work= |publisher= Census Commission of India}} Anjangaon had a population of 56,380. It is the third most populous city in [[Amravati District]] after Amravati and Achalpur. 29,017 are males while 27,363 are females. Anjangaon has a literacy rate of 88.93%, higher than the state average of 82.34%; with 91.01% of the males and 86.72% of females literate.[http://www.census2011.co.in/data/town/802684-anjangaon-maharashtra.html] 11.58% of the population is under 6 years of age. According to previous census, population of Anjangaon was 51,380 (2001), 41,674 (1991),[http://www.citypopulation.de/India-Maharashtra.html] 27,897(1971), 21,931(1961) and 11,881(1901).{{Cite web |url=http://amravati.nic.in/gazetteer/gazetteerA/home.html |title=Archived copy |access-date=22 June 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120506192832/http://amravati.nic.in/gazetteer/gazetteerA/home.html |archive-date=6 May 2012 |url-status=dead }} ==Notable places== [[File:Shahanur Dam.jpg|thumb|Shahanur Dam Image]] [[Shahanoor Dam]] (8 km) : This dam is built using soil and has a [[hydroelectricity]] generation project and water supply project for nearly 156 villages and 2 cities based on gravitation without using electricity. The dam is located in the north of the city in the ranges of [[Satpuda]]. The city has a few religious and spiritual places which are tourist destinations due to their beauty. *Digambar Jain Mandir (Neminath Bhagawan) Saokar Pura - Very Old Temple with Adinath Bhawgan Idol (replicate of Keshariyaji Idol) . *Devnath Math, Surji : This Math established in 1754 by Devnath Maharaj is a tourist's attraction. *[[Shendgaon]] an ancient village popularly known for Birth Place of [[Gadge Maharaj]] [[File:Sant Gadge Maharaj.jpg|thumb|Sant Gadge Maharaj statue]] *Tulja Bhavani Mata mandir(Rathod). *Vitthal Mandir :This temple was established by Ruplal Maharaj. *Sri Munje Baba Temple (Pan Atai) : Small temple situated in the neighborhood of pan atai. Family deity of Sumele and was established by Mr. Santosh Sumele. *Ekvira Devi Temple, Murha *Shri Deonath Maharaj Math, Surji *Gulab Baba Aashram, Takarkheda More [[File:A view of Gulaba Baba Ashram Takarkheda.jpg|thumb|right|A view of Gulab Baba Ashram Takarkheda More, Anjangaon Surji]] *Shri Ganpati Devasthan, Borala *Shri Balaji Sansthan, Kathipura *Digambar Kaanch Temple, Saokar Peth *Shri Sant Chandrabhaga Mata Temple, Kumbhargaon == Education == The first school in the town was started in 1868. This school, situated in Saokar Peth, is currently run as a Government school for girls. There are many educational institutions in the town, among which Sitabai Sangai High School, Junior College and Radhabai Sarda College are the most popular. The following is a list of schools and colleges in the area: {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} Sitabai Sangai Highschool{{cite web|url=http://sitabaisangai.org/index.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-06-23 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140813005820/http://sitabaisangai.org/index.html |archivedate=13 August 2014 |df=dmy }} *Nagar Parishad Urdu High School Killa *Sitabai Sangai Kanya Shala *Sitabai Sangai Prathamik Shala *Sitabai Sangai Jr. college. Sangai Naka Rd. *Raisaheb Moti Sangai English School *Smt. Radhabai Sarda College of Arts, Commerce and Science, Deogire Nagar., *Pragtik Vidyalaya, Main Rd. {{col-break}} *Green Hearts School (Gurukul), Vrindavan, achalpur Rd.,https://vasudhaabhyudayfoundation.org/https://vasudhaabhyudayfoundation.org/green-hearts-schoolhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IUD0MspxAvQ *Srinath jr. College, City Rd., *Dnyanpith D.Ed. College. panchayat samiti rd., *St. Mary's English School.Arokia Matha Church Compound, Daryapur Road *Smt.K.S.English School, station Rd., *Smt. Panchfulabai Harne Jr. College, Rest House Rd., *Smt.Radhabai Sarda Jr.College, Deogire Nagar., *Dnyanpith English School.Station Rd. {{col-break}} *Shrirang Chitrakala Mahavidyalaya, station rd., *Govt.Institute Of Tech. Industries, MIDC Rd., *Arts College, Tower Rd., *Smt.Indira Gandhi Technical College, Alkari Wada, P.O.rd., *Shri.Maniklalji Sarda D.Ed.College, Deogire Nagar., *Sri. Chintamani D.Ed. College, near Vyenktesh theater. *Rashtra Sant Tukdoji D.Ed. College, tehsil rd., surji. *Dr. Sufi Urdu junior college Arts & science. *Shantabai Shrivastava English School, Near water tank, Surji. *Study Circle Convent, Surji. {{col-end}}√ Apart from these institutions there is prestigious and well known NGO "LokSamruddhi : Rashtrahit Hi Parampara" ( लोकसमृद्धी : राष्ट्रहित ही परंपरा ) which is founded by General Secretary Rakesh V. Men alias Roshan Kumar is working on various topics which belongs to education sector. == Banking == There are a seven nationalised banks as well as co-operative banks in the city. A short list includes *State Bank of India, Axis Bank, *Central Bank of India, *Bank of Maharashtra, *Amravati District Co-op. Bank, *Union bank, HDFC *Bank of India (BOI), *Khmagaon bank, *Buldhana bank, *Janata Sahakari Bank. *Pusad Urban co-Op bank and Fino payment bank csp. == Culture == In Surji area Dwarkeshwar Yatra is a major event to be held every year on second day of Pola festival. Various religious functions are celebrated like Piwali Marbat, Rupalal Punyatithi, Chaitra Paurnima Rathotsav of Jains etc. ''Kathichi Jatra'' is a ''fair cum festival'' of the city. The fair is organised on every Monday from ''Nagapanchami'' to ''Pola'' Festival. ==Industry== [[File:Ambadevi Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana.jpg|thumb|Ambadevi Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana OLD Photo]] There is a co-operative sugar factory named as "Ambadevi Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana" which is not operational currently. The cotton ginning and pressing companies, [[sawmill]]s, oil mills are the main industries in the area. There are a few fruit packaging and agro product's companies. ==Fruit Cultivation and Marketing== Anjangaon Surji is famous for bananas and oranges. Anjangaon is the main centre for the supply of bananas in Maharashtra along with [[Jalgaon]]. Bananas are supplied across north India ([[Haryana]], [[Uttar Pradesh]], [[Jammu]], [[Punjab]], [[Uttarakhand]], [[Bihar]], [[Chhattisgarh]], [[Madhya Pradesh]], and [[Delhi]]) and [[Nepal]] from here. Anjangaon Surji is also one of the leading place for production of [[long pepper]] (Piper longum, or Pippali), sometimes called [[Indian long pepper]], is a flowering vine in the family Piperaceae, is also cultivated for its fruit, which is usually dried and used as a spice and seasoning. == Transport == [[File:NEW Bus Stand Anjangaon.jpg|thumb|Anjangaon Surji Bus Stand]] [[File:Anjangaon Railway .jpg|thumb|Anjangaon Railway Station]] Anjangaon is connected to [[Amravati]] (76 km), [[Paratwada]] (27 km) and [[Akola city|Akola]] (75 km) by roadways. The state transport (MSRTC) buses ply from Anjangaon to Amravati, Paratwada, Akola, Akot, Ramtek, Yavatmal, Pandharkavada, Nagpur, Aurangabad etc. Some private travel agencies run bus services to Pune and Mumbai. Anjangaon Surji is a station of [[Bhusaval]]–[[Nagpur]] section of [[Central Railway (India)|Central Railway]] on [[Achalpur]]-[[Murtijapur]] [[narrow gauge]] railway route. This narrow gauge train is popularly known as ''Shakuntala Express''. Nearest broad gauge railway station is Murtijapur(50 km).{{Cite web |url=http://amravati.nic.in/gazetteer/gazetteerb/comm_railways.html |title=Archived copy |access-date=22 June 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090410065343/http://amravati.nic.in/gazetteer/gazetteerB/comm_railways.html |archive-date=10 April 2009 |url-status=dead }} Nearest airports are [[Amravati Airport]] (75 km), [[Akola Airport]] (75 km) and [[Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar International Airport|Nagpur Airport]] (250 km). == References == * https://web.archive.org/web/20131206060026/http://santeknath.org/shishya%20parampara.html http://www.census2011.co.in/data/town/802684-anjangaon-maharashtra.html [[Category:Cities and towns in Amravati district]] [[Category:Talukas in Maharashtra]]
